snippet: Acting as an informant for the Federal Bureau of Investigation, Mr. Sharpton used a briefcase to secretly record conversations during his interactions with Mafia figures in the 1980s, according to a recent report.
abstract: Smoking Gun website reports that Rev Al Sharpton was an informer for the Federal Bureau of Investigation who had extensive dealings with Mafia figures in New York in the 1980s, secretly recording their conversations; site posts dozens of pages of documents that appear to provide details of Sharpton’s dealings with mob figures he knew from contacts in music industry; Sharpton says he was never told he was an informant.
lead_paragraph: Acting as an informant for the Federal Bureau of Investigation, Mr. Sharpton used a briefcase to secretly record conversations during his interactions with Mafia figures in the 1980s, according to a recent report.
